questions.clue: This composer is well-known for his 5th Symphony, famous for its 'short-short-short-long' motif.
This Austrian composer created the opera 'The Magic Flute' and died in 1791.
Known for 'The Four Seasons', this Baroque composer was also a virtuoso violinist.
This Russian composer is known for ballets such as 'Swan Lake' and 'The Nutcracker'.
This composer created the opera cycle 'The Ring of the Nibelung', which includes 'The Valkyrie'.
The closest star system to our solar system, just over 4 light-years away.
This galaxy, the closest large galaxy to the Milky Way, is on a collision course with us.
These stellar remnants are so dense that not even light can escape their gravitational pull.
This astronomical event occurs when a massive star explodes at the end of its life cycle.
This term describes a system of two stars orbiting around a common center of mass.
This river valley civilization, one of the earliest, flourished around 3100 BCE in what is now southern Iraq.
The Minoan civilization, known for its palaces and frescoes, thrived on this Mediterranean island until its decline around 1450 BCE.
This South American civilization, famous for its capital at Cusco and the site of Machu Picchu, was conquered by the Spanish in the 16th century.
This ancient kingdom located in the region of present-day Sudan was known for its iron production and trade network that linked Africa with the Mediterranean.
This ancient empire, which reached its peak under the rule of Ashurbanipal, fell to a coalition of Babylonians and Medes in 612 BCE.
This device involves an object, person, or situation having another meaning other than its literal meaning, often representing a larger concept or idea.
This device is a comparison using 'like' or 'as' to highlight similarities between two different things.
Involves the repetition of consonant sounds at the beginning of words to create rhythm or emphasis.
This device refers to a mild or indirect word or expression used in place of a harsh or blunt one, often to soften the impact.
This term describes a figure of speech in which apparently contradictory terms appear in conjunction, like 'deafening silence'.
This waterfall, located on the border of Ontario and New York, is one of the most famous in the world.
This mountain range, home to Mount Everest, spans five countries including Nepal and Bhutan.
Located off the coast of Queensland, this is the largest coral reef system in the world.
This South American waterfall is the world's tallest, with a drop of 3,212 feet.
This unique desert, known for its towering red sand dunes, is located in Namibia.

final.clue: This 1922 modernist novel, originally serialized over 2 years in the American journal 'The Little Review', was banned in the U.S. until 1933.
